intro: Microtoena praineana, commonly known as the Praine's microtoena, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
